intro: Ligusticum angelicifolium, commonly known as angelica-leaved lovage, is a perennial herb native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, fern-like foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade.
